cells.value:
We aim to prove $P \wedge Q \rightarrow Q \wedge P$\
We first assume $P \wedge Q$ and then show that $Q \wedge P$ is true.\
Since $P \wedge Q$ is true, $P$ (1) and $Q$ (2) are individually true.\
To prove the goal $Q \wedge P$ we must first prove $Q$ and then prove $P$.\
From (2) $Q$ is true.
From (1) $P$ is true.\
Thus, QED.

theorem and_commutative (P Q : Prop) : P /\ Q -> Q /\ P :=
begin
intro pq,
cases pq with p q,
split,
exact q, exact p,
end
